SECRET.
BATTLE SITUATION - NOON - 19th JUNe 1918.
1. WESTERN FRONT. The situation is unchanged.
2. ITALIAN FRONT.
Sixth Army. British captures now amount to over 1,000 prisoners, 5 mountain guns, 72 machine guns and 20 flame-throwers.
Italians have made some progress on COSTALUNGA and have taken 200 prisoners and 22 machine guns.
Fourth Army. Enemy local attacks on SOLAROLA salient repulsed during night of 17th/18th.
Eighth Army. Austrians attacked heavily on the MONTELLO during night of 17th/18th. Italian counter-attacks almost entirely restored situation, but enemy still holds railway embankment from SOVILLA level crossing to SAN ANDREA.
Third Army. Severe fighting from CANDELU to ZENS0N, but no change in situation, except that Italians have reached right bank of PIAVE on a front of 1 kilometre below SALETTO.
South of ZENSON Italians have been driven back from RONCHE and FOSSALTA to line of PALOMBO CANAL, and have lost CAPO D'ARGINE.
General Staff,
War Office, S.W.1.
19th June, 1918.
Issued at 12.30 p.m.
For the personal information - the Minister only. -
